thread.title: Dad's horror as baby daughter 'turns blue and almost chokes to death on Tommee Tippee dummy' - Mirror Online
thread.title_full: Dad's horror as baby daughter 'turns blue and almost chokes to death on Tommee Tippee dummy' - Mirror Online

author: Lucy Clarke-Billings
title: Dad's horror as baby daughter 'turns blue and almost chokes to death on Tommee Tippee dummy' - Mirror Online
text:
News Dad's horror as baby daughter 'turns blue and almost chokes to death on Tommee Tippee dummy' Earl Wilson revealed his concerns to friends on Facebook after buying the dummy from a B&M store for his 18-month-old daughter Share By Lucy Clarke-Billings Patrick Lion 19:25, 27 FEB 2017 The Tommee Tippee dummy bought by Earl Wilson for his daughter (Photo: Facebook) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A worried dad has warned parents about a dummy he bought for his baby daughter after he says she turned blue and almost choked to death. 
Earl Wilson, of Doncaster, revealed his concerns to friends on Facebook after buying the dummy from a B&M store for his 18-month-old daughter. 
His post has since gone viral on social media being shared more than 15,000 times and commented on 4000 times, with feedback agreeing and disagreeing with the problem. 
One mum said she had a similar choking problem with her child but another mother insisted she had had no problems with the same product. The Tommee Tippee dummy (Photo: Facebook) 
Tommee Tippee tonight said it would launch and investigate and contact the parents while insisting all of our products comply with strict European safety standards. 
In his post, Mr Wilson wrote: "Beware, my daughter nearly choked on this Tommee Tippee soother yesterday morning," 
"If it wasn't for my wife's quick thinking I'd hate to think what would of happened. 
"My daughter turned blue and Sam had to remove the teat from her throat. 
"My main concern is it's an owl dummy (associated with night) so people will be using it at bed time. 
"I don't think my daughter would be here now if this happened in the middle of the night. 
"I've been to B&M on York Road and they say they're going to contact head office." Read More There could be mould hiding inside your baby's Sophie the Giraffe toy 
A Kathleen Pollock replied: "My daughter almost choked on one of these as well, I heard a muffled noise and when I went into the room she had the whole dummy in her mouth and it was lodged, I believe the dummies are too small and something needs to be done by tommy tippee." 
But Natasha Louise Hunter Dodds said she had no problems with the product. 
"My son has these exact dummies he has had them about 4 months and they are fine," she said. 
"I bought mine from Morrisons and had no problems." 
A spokesman for Tommee Tippee said: "The safety and wellbeing of babies is at the heart of absolutely everything we do, so we’re taking this extremely seriously. 
"We’re very sorry that Earl and his wife and daughter have had this experience; it must have been very distressing for them. Read More Ocado launch sale deals on hundreds of baby essentials including buy one get one free on Pampers nappies 
"We’re going to investigate this thoroughly, and would like to speak to Earl as soon as we possibly can, so we can get the soother back and examine it. We have already contacted them and are waiting to hear back. 
"We would like to reassure parents that all of our products comply with strict European safety standards. 
"In addition, to give parents further reassurance before using the soother, we always recommend they pull the soother in all directions and look for bite marks before every single use, and throw away at the first signs of damage or weakness. 
"Anyone with any questions or concerns can contact us via our Facebook page or via our Careline 0500 97 98 99." 
A spokesperson from B&M, said: “The care and safety of our customers is our top priority so we have asked our supplier to investigate this incident.” Like us on Facebook
